div.p: The Norfolk Daily News will be including a publication in honor of our 2020 Graduates. It's been a very un-traditional year for them to be sure! We wanted to include something to honor and recognize them. The publication will print May 15th. It will include a listing of high school seniors from each town in our coverage area, just as our sports sections each year.Â You also have the option to send a picture of your senior to the Norfolk Daily News to be published on May 15th. Submission deadline is May 8th. There is a fee of $5.00. Click on the link below for details, and for a form to fill out if you are interested.

a.aria-label: Read more about Salute Your Senior

div.p: There are some surplus desks available to you and your students at the Lynch campus.Â If you are interested in a student desk, please call Amy at the BC Lynch campus 402-569-2081.Â She is available on Monday through Thursday from 8:00 to noon.

div.p: As we experience the coronavirus outbreak, we are hit with a variety of emotions: fear, anxiety, loneliness, etc. There are a number of locations around our area that are taking on new patients for telehealthÂ counseling services. Many of these services can be covered by insurance.Â You can find a list of services below.

How does telehealth impact individuals every day? There is growing awareness and support for mental health conditions, however,Â one in every five US adultsÂ is diagnosed with a mental health disorder every year.Â Additionally, anotherÂ 56% of AmericansÂ who have a mental health condition do not get adequate treatment.

Though there are many reasons that impact if someone receives proper treatment, one very important factor in this statistic is access to care. As of December 2017, there areÂ 5,042 designated mental health shortage areasÂ across the United States, leaving over 120 million people without access to proper mental health services.

This is where telehealth comes into play. Â Teletherapy is an important (although not the only) step in correcting this statistic and offering care to those who need it most. Studies have consistently shown the positive benefits virtual mental health services can have on individuals.

span.span: Beacon of Hope Counseling CenterÂ Â 308-532-0777

h3.a: Managing Anxiety and Stress During the COVID-19 Outbreak

div.p: The outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) may be stressful for people. Fear and anxiety about a disease can be overwhelming and cause strong emotions in adults and children. Coping with stress will make you, the people you care about, and your community stronger. To add more stress during these crazy times, parents had to become homeschool teachers overnight, with little warning or time to prepare. There is no shame in admitting that you are stressed and full of anxiety. There are many parents and students all going through it.Â The links below share helpful information about making sure parents and students are taking care of their mental health as well as their physical health.

a.span: How to Homeschool During the Novel Coronavirus Outbreak
Taking Care of Your Mental Health in the Face of Uncertainty
If your child's school closes, don't panic: Here's a list of homeschooling resources

a.aria-label: Read more about Managing Anxiety and Stress During the COVID-19 Outbreak
